title: Remove in-process AppService lifetime restrictions
body: Currently an in-process appservice can be invoked without actually launching the main app ui. However once a user launch the main app ui and close it, appservice is also terminated (because both shared same process).

comments.body: @Ipatov Consider a scenario where background service need ui input on first connection like a password to initialise its state. When ui is gone, app service is gone and hence state.
It's OK to terminate app. App service should be restarted (without UI) on next request.
